content: The Codex team at OpenAI uses an hourly automation to scan for and resolve merge conflicts in their codebase, ensuring code is always ready to ship.
Automations in the Codex app allow users to schedule prompts to run at a set cadence (hourly, daily, etc.).
Skills in the Codex app bundle instructions to connect to external tools and run workflows beyond code generation, including research, reporting, and writing.
The Codex team uses an automation that picks a random file from the codebase and looks for bugs, using a random number generator to explore different corners and catch non-critical bugs.
The Codex team employs a 'silent bug fixer' automation that reviews pull requests, scans for signs of breakage, and pushes a fix before a bug is noticed.
The Codex team uses an automation to generate a daily team digest at 9 a.m., summarizing everything merged the previous day, grouped by contributor and theme.
The Codex team uses an automation for daily marketing intelligence that searches the web for user perceptions of Codex and compiles them into a short report.
